atlantis.gamedata.region¶

Handles Atlantis PBEM regions.

Regions (hexes) are one the main entities in Atlantis PBEM. All game action takes place in an hexagonal map made of Region elements. Each of these regions has a list of Structure structures, and each of these structures has a list of Unit units inside.

Regions represent the main point where players interact with surrounding world. They provide the players of money throught taxing or Region’s markets, control movement, are battle fields, etc.

Main class in atlantis.gamedata.region is Region, which holds and handle all data about these terrain hexes.

Public classes in atlantis.gamedata.region module:

Region Holds all data of an Atlantis PBEM region.

Region¶

class atlantis.gamedata.region.Region(location, terrain, name=None, population=0, racenames=None, wealth=0, town=None)¶

Holds all data of an Atlantis PBEM region.

Region has the following public attributes:

report¶
List of report lines describing the region.
location¶
Region location, as a three elements tuple.
terrain¶
Terrain type of the region.
name¶
Name of the region.
population¶
Inhabitants in the region.
racenames¶
Name (plural) of the race living in the region.
wealth¶
Amount available for taxing.
town¶
Dictionary with *name* and *type* of the present town if any.
entertainment¶
Entertainment available in the region.
weather¶
Dictionary with *last*, *next*, *clearskies* and *blizzard*.
First two keys are weather for *last* and *next* month
respectively, while the latter are flags telling if last
month weather was caused by ``Clear Skies`` or ``Blizzard``
spells.
wages¶
Wages available in the region. It's a dictionary with
*productivity* and *amount* values. The first is the amount
received per man and month by work, while the latter is the
maximum total amount available in the region.
__init__(location, terrain, name=None, population=0, racenames=None, wealth=0, town=None)¶

Create a new region.

Regions will be created by several Atlantis report. When reported in battle only location and terrain are given. when it’s a nearby region we’ll get also its name and present town, if any. And when we visit the region population and wealth information are given.

Parameters:
  • location – Location as a three elements tuple, containing xloc, yloc and zloc.
  • terrain – Terrain type of the region.
  • name – Name of the region the hexagon belongs to.
  • population – Number of inhabitants of the region.
  • racenames – Name (plural) of the race living in the region.
  • wealth – Amount available for taxing.
  • town – Dictionary with name and type of the town.
set_report_description(line)¶

Set a new description string from read report line.

Parameters:line – report line describing the item.
append_report_description(line)¶

Append a new report line to item description.

Parameters:line – report line to be appended to item description.
set_entertainment(amount)¶

Set region entertainment.

Parameters:amount – Entertainment available in the region.
set_weather(weather, nxtweather, clearskies=False, blizzard=False)¶

Set region weather information.

Parameters:
  • weather – last month weather. Valid values are clear, winter, monsoon season and blizzard.
  • nxtweather – next month weather. Valid values are clear, winter and monsoon season. Unnatural values are not allowed here.
  • clearskies – if True, last month weather was caused by a Clear Skies spell. Defaults to False.
  • blizzard – if True, last month weather was caused by a Blizzard spell. Defaults to False.
set_wages(productivity, amount)¶

Set region wages.

Parameters:
  • productivity – wages obtained per man and month.
  • amount – total amount of wages available in the region.
set_market(market, items)¶

Set region market.

Parameters:
  • market – market type. Allowed values are sell and buy.
  • items – list of ItemMarket objects.
update(region)¶

Update region with new data.

This method will update current region with new data about the region. New data can be partial, so not all old data will be overwritten.

Parameters:region – A Region object with new data.
Raise :KeyError if region it’s not the same (locations does not coincide).
